January 15, 1969
Mr. Joseph C* Dine
Information Consultant
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
545 Madison Avenue, 6th floor
New York, New York 100222
Dear Joe:
Miss Landreth delivered the material we discussed
at lunch to your Washington office on Monday after¬
noon. I trust you received it.
I*ve some second thoughts about a glossary of terms.
First, I discover that the National Catholic Office
for Radio and Television (NCORT) at One Rockefeller
Plaza, New York has published such a glossary. If
you review a copy you*11 find It is generally satis¬
factory but it unfortunately does not define some of
the language used in our facet of broadcasting*
For example, terms excluded are#
Public Radio
Non-commercial Radio
Educational Radio$
Instructional Radio
Campus Radio
College Radio
Perhaps a liaison can be established whereby edu¬
cational broadcasting•s terminology could be included
in an updated version of the NCORT Glossary*
Finally, I*m reluctant to impose our definitions on
others. Since a rather extensive study is being made
by Samuel Holt of Educational Radio it might be that
Holt and his crew could offer the best definitions
available.
1*11 await your reaction. It was good talking with
you and we are looking forward to continuing our excel¬
lent association with the Corporation for Public Broad¬
casting.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
